thread.title: Millwall fans racially abuse Tottenham hat-trick hero Son Heung-Min during FA Cup defeat at White Hart Lane
thread.title_full: Millwall fans racially abuse Tottenham hat-trick hero Son Heung-Min during FA Cup defeat at White Hart Lane

author: Martin Domin
title: Millwall fans racially abuse Tottenham hat-trick hero Son Heung-Min during FA Cup defeat at White Hart Lane
text:
Son Heung-Min hit a hat-trick against Millwall (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Millwall fans appeared to racially abuse Tottenham forward Son Heung-Min during their side's FA Cup defeat at White Hart Lane. 
Chants of "DVD" and "three for a fiver", apparently in reference to the sale of pirated films, coursed through the away end each time Son touched the ball in the last-eight clash. 
But the 24-year-old South Korea international silenced the visiting support by scoring a hat-trick as Spurs ran out 6-0 winners to progress to the semi-finals. 
Earlier, police had to intervene as fans of both sides clashed before kick-off. Millwall fans at White Hart Lane (Photo: AFP) Son fires home as Tottenham thrashed Milwall (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Harry Kane limps off injured just five minutes into FA Cup quarter-final 
Officers were posted across north London with some in riot gear and others on horse back. 
Smoke bombs were left off outside the ground while inside, signs were removed from the away end in a bid to minimise damage. 
Last season, Arsenals fans tore them down after being kept behind after a victory over their bitter rivals. There was a heavy police presence before kick-off (Photo: REUTERS) Smoke bombs were thrown by fans outside the ground (Photo: PA) Some police were on horse back (Photo: REUTERS) Like us on Facebook
